data.states package

Submodules

data.states.options module

class data.states.options.Options[source]

Bases: State

cleanup()[source]

Called when the state leaves the top of the state stack.

render()[source]

Meant to render all the state’s elements to the screen.

startup()[source]

Called when the state enters the top of the state stack.

update()[source]

Called before self.render, meant to update all the state elements.

update_screen()[source]

Method meant to update the screen variables of all elements in the state using it.

data.states.state module

class data.states.state.State[source]

Bases: ABC

Parent class for creating _states.

back()[source]

Default behaviour exits to the previous states, however should be overriden in certain cases e.g. for the first state.

class data.states.state.StateManager(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Class for interacting with the state stack.

append(state_name)[source]

Gets the state object from the name passed and appends the state name to the end of the state stack. Calls relevant startup and cleanup methods.

Parameters:

state_name (str) – The name of the state to append as stored in the

_states property dictionary.

Raises:

KeyError – When state_name is not present in the _states

property dictionary.

back_to(state_name)[source]

Removes every state on top of the state to go back to, and calls the relevant startup and cleanup methods (only of the top state and state moving back to, _states inbetween are ignored).

Parameters:

state_name (str) – The name of the state to go back to as stored in the _states property dictionary.

Raises:

KeyError – When state_name is not present in the _states property dictionary.

property current_state
property input_binder
property input_manager
pop()[source]

Removes the last state from the state stack, calls relevant startup and cleanup methods.

quit()[source]
property state_stack
switch(state_name)[source]

Removes the last state from the state stack, gets the state object from the name passed and appends the state name to the end of the state stack. Calls relevant startup and cleanup. methods.

Parameters:

state_name (str) – The name of the state to switch as stored in the _states property dictionary.

Raises:

KeyError – When state_name is not present in the _states property dictionary.
